subject: toytoolkit: always mask the frame, even in maximized mode
commitMessage:
toytoolkit: always mask the frame, even in maximized mode

When a toytoolkit window was maximized, we avoided some
processing by not setting the transparency and mask of the
underlying frame, because the visible result were the
shadows -which are not supposed to be shown in this state.

However, with some GL implementations (ex: Tizen Emulator
with YaGL), this defines a totally transparent window which
is then not shown, leaving the impression that the client
is hung.

Bug-Tizen: TC-2276
Change-Id: I9459e5f177461746efbf3c0a7e1610ac441d8388
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

please remove "\n" after Bug-Tizen: and add Forwarded: url if possible
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Done the "\n".
For the "forwarded" part, there is no upstream version yet, but I am working on it (as commented in https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TC-2276).
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

subject: compositor-drm: Improve video initialization times
commitMessage:
compositor-drm: Improve video initialization times

If we are using the DRM backend, and a fixed video mode was
specified in "weston.ini", try to discover DRM modes until
a matching one is found ; then stop.

Reverse the modes loop order ; from the highest resolution
to the lowest now, which is a more frequent use case.

Change-Id: I9832e4081df0d8e94edb997359f447536abe4280
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

-1 until we get a feedback from the QA team.

subject: packaging: add the Q&A patches for Common
commitMessage:
packaging: add the Q&A patches for Common

If we are on Common, we will apply the following patches :

- FPS binding (Shift+Mod+Space+P) : FPS counter
- Surfaces list binding (Shift+Mod+Space+L) : Surfaces listing
- Q&A protocol, Q&A client (weston-qa-listsurfaces) in a new
"weston-qatools" package.

Change-Id: If2f56713b68c4d6f617151c34e0ce4789c9990f1
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Add a test case of eglLockSurface
commitMessage:
Add a test case of eglLockSurface

pvrtest-1.0.0 offers an eglLockSurface test case, but it was written for X-Window.
So egl-lock-surface.c was added to run this test case under Wayland.
